intro: Grastidium fulgescens, commonly known as the golden spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and striking yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Grastidium fulgescens is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, waxy leaves.
